PR_Title: feat(testing): add e2e test for windows and linux
Comment:
Hey @louis030195 — yep, you got it!

Here’s a plain-English breakdown of what the E2E test setup actually does:

* Sets up the environment to build a release version.
* Installs `tauri-driver` to automate the app during tests.
* Grabs the right version of Edge WebDriver to drive the app's built-in browser.
* Runs the test suite using WebdriverIO

  * The main test opens the app, skips onboarding, closes the changelogs popup, clicks the health icon, and checks that the app shows "screenpipe is running smoothly."

* While the tests run, a script (`record.js`) kicks off ffmpeg to record the desktop.

 * Starts recording at the beginning, stops at the end, and saves the video.

* Uploads the screen recording and test logs as artifacts to GitHub Actions.
* Also uploads the `.screenpipe` folder (which might have logs, DB files, or mp4s the app made during the test).


So yep — your understanding is spot on: the test is recorded, and the video gets uploaded for review!

Let me know if you want to tweak anything in the setup or if something seems off!

PR_Title: feat(testing): add e2e test for windows and linux
Comment:
@louis030195 here is the video of our terminator based e2e test setup

as these does not require heavy things like wdio or playwright etc

PR_Title: revert libsamplerate cause it fails build
Comment:
this is still won't fix the compilation error of `libsamplerate` 

the issue is with cmake version and adding this line will fix the issue:
```rust
        .define("CMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM", "3.5");
```

here: https://github.com/Prior99/libsamplerate-sys/blob/e4461748f110a7687cfb7340311b43bd79310199/build.rs#L9

also in `rust-samplerate` there is need to update the `libsamplerate`

maybe @louis030195 should fork these repos, would be better for future updates
https://github.com/Prior99/rust-samplerate.git
https://github.com/Prior99/libsamplerate-sys

PR_Title: revert libsamplerate cause it fails build
Comment:
@tribhuwan-kumar I know that this PR not a fix to that issue 

My PR just revert the commit so that the build works on windows

BTW instead of doing      ```   .define("CMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM", "3.5"); ```

we should instead edit this line and change the version number to ```3.16```
 ```cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.16)```
 
 this is because https://github.com/libsndfile/libsamplerate/commit/15c392d47e71b9395a759544b3818a1235fe1a1d
 
 also we will need to do  this thing in the following repo (some might have git-module which has the cmake thing)
 
 https://github.com/Prior99/rust-samplerate.git
https://github.com/Prior99/libsamplerate-sys
https://github.com/divanshu-go/knf-rs
https://github.com/thewh1teagle/vad-rs
https://github.com/tazz4843/whisper-rs

`ALL OF THESE REPO DEPEND ON CMAKE `

they have circular dependencies over each other and therefore this is more bigger issue and needs to be solved (also making sure we revert the code chnages in these repo that we dont need for now using ```git revert```)

PR_Title: feat: support for active Browser URL detection in linux
Comment:
@tribhuwan-kumar I think you need to kill that pid 

reason -->  browsers reads the following value
 ```bash
 dbus-send --print-reply --type=method_call --dest=org.a11y.Bus /org/a11y/bus org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.Set string:org.a11y.Status string:IsEnabled variant:boolean:true
 ```

and then they start appearing on atspi tree

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65946258/firefox-at-spi-support-in-ubuntu

PR_Title: feat: support for active Browser URL detection in linux
Comment:

>  ```
>

PR_Title: Add: Client screenshot to server
Comment:
You need to enable FTP on the server. You can enable it from `Turn Windows Features on and off` on the Windows server.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ebfb0a1-f2d9-46db-af3b-49ddc16e487a)

After that, you can start and check FTP services from powershell as administrator using this command on the Windows Server
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd9467d4-48ab-4fb9-8e77-c873b271165b)

Don't forget to allow user for using FTP from Internet Information Service (IIS)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43fbc694-dc6b-4cea-b374-6f02ad7525ae)

After all are ready, we can go to the next step for sending screenshot to the Windows Server. This is provided example from my devices.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e30d35a-a8de-435a-ad2d-3bd51409c760)

This is provided binary for test the program
[Program.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19473173/Program.zip)
